remarks: Induction on the upper integers that start at ` M ` .  The first hypothesis specifies the lower bound, the next four give us the substitution instances we need, and the last two are the basis and the induction step.  (Contributed by NM, 4-Sep-2005.)
statement:
uzind4i.1 $e |- M e. ZZ $.
uzind4i.2 $e |- ( j = M -> ( ph <-> ps ) ) $.
uzind4i.3 $e |- ( j = k -> ( ph <-> ch ) ) $.
uzind4i.4 $e |- ( j = ( k + 1 ) -> ( ph <-> th ) ) $.
uzind4i.5 $e |- ( j = N -> ( ph <-> ta ) ) $.
uzind4i.6 $e |- ps $.
uzind4i.7 $e |- ( k e. ( ZZ>= ` M ) -> ( ch -> th ) ) $.
uzind4i $p |- ( N e. ( ZZ>= ` M ) -> ta ) $.
$d M j k $.
$d N j $.
$d ch j $.
$d j ps $.
$d j ta $.
$d j th $.
$d k ph $.
